elements: If the mind is a blade, this is a whetstone. [Study with two Erudition to gain Reason.]

'The poet makes himself a seer by an immense, long, deliberate derangement of all the senses...' The opposite of wisdom, thankfully. [Study with two Glimmerings to gain Passion... though this sometimes fails.]

A dreadful souffl√© of half-digested rumour about the 'Secret Worlds' and the irrelevance of contemporary morality. None of it seems true, but it is very grandly written and does describe a catalogue of unlikely, and probably invented, debaucheries. Readings might impress the impressionable. [If I've bought this from a shop, it probably means there is nothing else of interest left in stock.].
